original: Jacobsson, Erik Ragnar, landssekreterare, Kalmar, f. 19/3/89 i Perstorp, Krist. 1., av s’tat:insp. Nils J. o. Mathilda Johansson. G. 16 m. Agnes von Ekensteen. Barn: Nils-Erik f. 17, tj :-man v. länsstyr. i Sthlm, Anne-Marie 20, g. m. löjtn. v. Bergslag. art:reg. Lars-Ingemar Berg. —■ Stud:ex. i Hälsingborg 07, jur. kand. i Lund 12. Tingstjg. 12-15, e. länsnot. v. länsstyr. i Umeå 15-19, länsnot. i Visby 19, rådm. där 20, länsassessor i Gbg 36, landssekr. i Kalmar 1. sed. 40. Sekr. h. Gotl. 1. landsting 19, ordf. i styr. f. sjukh. o. arb:förmedL RNO, RVO.
translated: Jacobsson, Erik Ragnar, county secretary, Kalmar, born on March 19, 1889 in Perstorp, Krist. 1., son of inspector Nils J. and Mathilda Johansson. Married on June 16 to Agnes von Ekensteen. Children: Nils-Erik, born in 1917, working as an official at the county board in Stockholm, and Anne-Marie, born in 1920, married to Lieutenant Lars-Ingemar Berg of the Bergslag Artillery Regiment. Jacobsson passed his matriculation exam in Helsingborg in 1907 and obtained a law degree from Lund University in 1912. He served as a deputy judge from 1912-1915, deputy district notary at the county board in Umeå from 1915-1919, district notary in Visby in 1919, city councilor there in 1920, county assessor in Gothenburg in 1936, and county secretary in Kalmar since 1940. He was the secretary of the Gotland county council in 1919, and the chairman of the board for hospitals and employment agencies. He was awarded the Order of the North Star and the Order of Vasa.

structured.name: Erik Ragnar Jacobsson
structured.description: Erik Ragnar Jacobsson (1889- ) was a Swedish county secretary who served in various government positions throughout his career.
